author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Sunday laid foundation stones for works including construction of bridges, flyovers, rail over bridges and roads at a total cost of Rs. 1,002 crore.

At an event held through video conferencing from the Secretariat, she laid the foundation stones for three projects that would bring much relief to motorists in Chennai – grade separators at the Vijaya Nagar Junction at Velachery at a cost of Rs. 108 crore, Medavakkam Junction at a cost of Rs. 146 crore and at the junction of Kaliamman Koil Street and Inner Ring Road at a cost of Rs. 93.50 crore.

In Tiruvallur district, work on a rail over bridge at a cost of Rs. 24.50 crore to replace Level Crossing 15 at Sevvapet, a long-pending demand of the people of that area, is expected to commence shortly.

Ms. Jayalalithaa also laid the foundation stone for a bridge estimated at Rs. 2.50 crore in Villupuram across the Attruthangudi Odai and three bridges in Cuddalore district at Melur, Natarajapuram across Uppanar and at Bhuvanagiri across thr Vellar.

She also inaugurated several buildings including a combined office for the Chief Engineers of six divisions of the Highways department, the Ennore Port link road, a four-lane bridge across Palar on the ECR constructed at a cost of Rs. 105.20 crore.

‘Kalaivanar Arangam’ inaugurated

Chief Minister Jayalalithaa inaugurated ‘Kalaivanar Arangam’ - an auditorium off Anna Salai that can seat about 2,400 people, through video conferencing on Sunday. The auditorium spread over 1.92 lakh sq. metre with state-of-the-art facilities has been constructed at a cost of Rs. 62.73 crore, according to an official release.
title: Foundation for projects worth Rs. 1,002 cr. laid
